channel.title: Show Bootstrapped - Discuss @ Bootstrapped.fm
channel.description: Topics in the 'Show Bootstrapped' category Show & Tell is a place where you can show the products you've created and tell everyone a bit about them. This is also the place to request for other forum members to evaluate your product and provide some feedback.

item.title: Documentation app demo - feedback please
item.dc:creator: mattbearman
item.description:
Hi all, some of you may remember me as the former owner of Saber Feedback. I’ve been living the 9-5 life for a couple of years now, but the old side project itch has returned

I realise this community is not long for this world, but I’d really appreciate feedback from you all on my very early stage project. (It’s just a demo video and some basic questions at the moment)

Google Docs

Documentation tool research

I'm currently developing a tool which aims to be the quickest and easiest way to create and manage documentation and knowledge bases for web apps. Basically it's the tool I wish I had when I was running Saber Feedback. I've got as far as building a...

Thanks
Matt

4 posts - 3 participants

item.title: AI Copywriting Tool & AI Content Writer - Qopywriter.ai
item.dc:creator: carlsen
item.description:
Hey everyone! We recently launched new product https:// qopywriter.ai.
Qopywriter.ai is AI-powered software that writes articles for you. Qopywriter.ai is a cloud-based AI-powered content writer, which allows everyone to produce high-quality articles in seconds. This AI software will assist you in generating thousands of blog posts, articles, essays, press releases and more.
There is no scraping or spinning happening in the background. We use state-of-the-art language models based on deep learning algorithms to generate human-like articles.
Will be happy to hear your feedback. Thanks

item.title: Marble customer training platform
item.dc:creator: Marble
item.description:
We make customer training accessible.

Marble is a customer training platform for small and medium-sized companies to educate their customers with minimum costs while connected with customer success strategy.

If your business spends a lot of money on face-to-face training of the customers, you have no time on adopting complex learning management systems or spend weeks on content creation, then Marble is for you.

So, why Marble?

Companies become successful learning providers and build learning communities around their products.

Marble is a new generation learning platform which helps companies to create embedded academies, educate their customers with an intuitive training builder.

It is designed and created by learning experts and PhD in education technology. We combine most effective teaching approaches based on research and advanced user interface for customer centered education.

Marble scr1_21306×911 173 KB

1 post - 1 participant

Read full topic
item.source: Marble customer training platform

item.title: Demostory.io the browser for live demos
item.dc:creator: Chris_Colburn
item.description:
Hey Everyone,
Today my partner and I launched our company, demostory.io. A browser built for live software demos, it eliminates the need to log in and out, jump between browser windows, and you can save the entire demo and launch it in seconds!

My experience is as an SE doing large enterprise demos. Chrome is great for every-day-use, unfortunately though those same features can complicate your demo especially if you want to show multiple users or collaboration.

Me and my cofounder bootstrapped this ourselves with the help of online forums like this + fiverr and upwork.

We have a free 1 month trail and would love some feedback. If you are bootstrapping your startup and find the tool useful reach out to me we can work something out.

3 posts - 3 participants

Read full topic
item.source: Demostory.io the browser for live demos

item.title: UserBooster - A Notion dashboard that helps you build your launch strategy
item.dc:creator: xavier
item.description:
My 4th project is out and it’s called UserBooster

It’s a Notion Dashboard that helps you build your launching strategy and get early traction.

Why did I create this?

A LOT of entrepreneurs have difficulties launching their products and getting their first users.
This dashboard will help you setting up your launching strategy and leverage existing communities to get early traction.

What’s inside:

  • Strategies on how to launch and prioritize your actions
  • 70+ tools to help you build and prepare your launch.
  • 40+ curated resources to help you at each stage of your launch.
  • Very detailed tips for leveraging acquisition channels
    and more!

userbooster summary1640×924

Each page contains:

  • The overall strategy
  • Actionable content
  • Additional resources to go deeper
  • Tools or checklist to help you

userbooster detail1640×924

A toolKit

I curated a list of 70+ tools to help you with:

  • Landing Page build
  • Payment solution
  • Design
  • Mailing
  • Automation
  • Data handling

If you think UserBooster can help you or help other makers:

Check it out → gum.co/userbooster

3 posts - 2 participants

Read full topic
item.source: UserBooster - A Notion dashboard that helps you build your launch strategy

item.title: TempEmailify - A browser extension for Quick short-lived email accounts for free
item.dc:creator: karthikeyan_rajendra
item.description:
Hey there,

I just launched my new project: TempEmailify a browser extension for Quick short-lived email accounts for free.

tempemailify.versoly.page

Thinking about the problems I use to face while building web applications. I took my note, started listing out problems and the solutions I used at that time. By analyzing I found a simple problem on the usability of temp-email extensions.

It turned out to be a problem worth solving that led me to the idea for TempEmailify!

Any feedback is more than welcome!

item.source: TempEmailify - A browser extension for Quick short-lived email accounts for free

item.title: Modern, and social, travel planning. Finally, no more spreadsheets!
item.dc:creator: BluePlanit
item.description:
My friends and I built Blue Planit, a travel planning app, to accomplish two things:

  1. Make it faster and easier to plan a trip.
    How - autofill event details and mark on map. Fast drag and drop of events with all details.

  2. Enable anyone to discover itineraries others have created and start planning with existing trips. How - copy the entirety of existing trips others have created that can then be customized.

We built Blue Planit because when planning our own trips, we always defaulted to using a shared Google Doc and marking Google Maps. It was always so manual and time consuming, so we decided to build a more integrated and automated solution that also brought the social aspect of discovering trip itineraries others have made. We loved the design of Trello so were inspired to use dran-n-drop cards in our design.

Would love for you to check it out and provide any feedback after you’ve tried it out! (Google “blue planit”, I can’t post a link)

Soon to come! Real-time collaborative trip planning (like editing Google Docs simultaneously)

1 post - 1 participant

Read full topic
item.source: Modern, and social, travel planning. Finally, no more spreadsheets!

item.title: Create videos with tons of friends
item.dc:creator: ZZalexa
item.description:
Hey y’all! Currently working on a project called ZigZag, which is an ios app.

On the app, users can co-create videos with as many friends as they like. Once videos go live on the feed, all of the likes & comments are attributed to all contributors - so everyone is rewarded for creating “viral content”.

Would love for y’all to check it out & feedback us! You can find it by searching “ZigZag video” in the App Store.

Thanks!

item.title: Side Project : Games with Gran
item.dc:creator: Rhino
item.description:
Side Project : Games with Gran

I’ve built a side project - Games With Gran.

“Classic games like Tic Tac Toe & Four in a Row and Checkers with built in super simple and secure video conferencing to help keep your family in touch.”

https://www.gameswithgran.com/

The idea was born in Covid Lockdowns to try and help my Grandparents keep in touch with my young kids using simple games.

As with all the best side projects I’ve given ZERO thought in how to market this or monitize this (though thats not a priority to be fair, should be very modest cost to run).

Hopefully some of you may find it useful.

Any ideas especially on Marketing / Monitizing?

item.title: Seeking Feedback on Talk Howdy: Community Platform
item.dc:creator: TalkHowdy
item.description:
Hey y’all! My startup, Talk Howdy, is currently seeking beta testers/feedback on our product and messaging. We’d love to hear your thoughts.

Elevator pitch: Talk Howdy is a platform for finding and creating online communities: connect to people with shared interests through small group, virtual meetups.

Lander copy:
DISCOVER A COMMUNITY
Communities are a place to communicate about shared interests with certain people. You can create a community for anything - your alumni group, your book club, or your underground society.

DISCUSS WHAT INTERESTS YOU
Attend virtual meetups with your community using our integrated video platform. Use the discussion board to pose topics for conversation, share your thoughts, and connect with community members.

ONE STREAMLINED PLATFORM
Say goodbye to the days of using multiple platforms to get connected. Stay in touch with your crew all through your community homepage on Howdy.

Thanks!

2 posts - 2 participants

Read full topic
item.source: Seeking Feedback on Talk Howdy: Community Platform

item.title: Landing page and signup feedback
item.dc:creator: theallan
item.description:
Hi all,

I’m the author of the DataTables Javascript library and have been working on a SaaS version of the software - basically hosted tables which you can perform CRUD operations on - the result is CloudTables.

To some degree it can be likened to AirTable, but we are going for full integration with your site - embedding directly into it, not just as an iframe. We also are building on our DataTables and Editor products (along with all the extensions we publish for them) so it has really strong foundations. CloudTables is basically a UI around DataTables and Editor.

Why this approach? Running DataTables (open source) and Editor (commercial) as developer libraries takes a lot of support effort, so with CloudTables we are progressing a little away from targeting code only developers, to provide a service which is more suited to those who just want to get CRUD table basics done so they can get on with other aspects of the business and also those who are perhaps newer to programming. Hopefully it will reduce the support burden while also opening a new revenue stream.

I’d really welcome feedback not just on the landing page, but also the initial flow of getting started - creating a new CloudTable and using it!

Regards,
Allan

7 posts - 5 participants

Read full topic
item.source: Landing page and signup feedback

item.title: My interview on the UI Breakfast podcast
item.dc:creator: SteveMcLeod
item.description:
I was recently interviewed by Jane Portman for the UI Breakfast podcast.

What are the main differences between running desktop apps versus web apps? And which of the two comes with less hassle and problems down the line? Our guest today is Steve McLeod, the founder of Feature Upvote and acquirer of Saber Feedback. You’ll hear Steve’s opinion on switching from desktop to web-based apps, the various maintenance and support issues that may arise, the “boring” aspects of running complex software, and how to prevent the stress that often comes with SaaS.

Listen here.

1 post - 1 participant

Read full topic
item.source: My interview on the UI Breakfast podcast

item.title: Show Bootstrapped: Introducing SeeLink - A Link Sharing and Collaboration Platform
item.dc:creator: _RN
item.description:
Hello Bootstrapped Community!

I’m proud to introduce a web-app I’ve been working on for the past few months, SeeLink.

SeeLink is a link sharing and collaboration platform that enables you to save and share links from all around the web.

What’s SeeLink For?

SeeLink is one of the first link sharing and collaboration platforms. SeeLink enables its users to store, share, and save links from all around the web. You could use SeeLink to store links of your interest, and share them with friends, family, or teammates.

Why was SeeLink created?

SeeLink was created to simplify sharing links with friends and family. Conventionally, sharing links with people was done through messaging apps, where they would get lost in the sea of messages. SeeLink allows its users to create boards to share links with specific people, allowing them to save and share human-readable links at the click of a button.

There’s still a lot that I’d like to improve in SeeLink, and if there’s anything you’d like to see added to that list, please let me know! Also, I’m looking to get some user feedback before I launch to more people, so all feedback is welcome!

You can join SeeLink and try it out at the seelink.app (not hyperlinked as new users aren’t allowed to put links in posts, for some reason)!

Thanks.

1 post - 1 participant

Read full topic
item.source: Show Bootstrapped: Introducing SeeLink - A Link Sharing and Collaboration Platform

item.title: My latest project - a data management tool
item.dc:creator: jcadam
item.description:
Hello all,

It’s been a couple of years since I’ve posted here. I’ve had a number of failed attempts at starting a software business, and eventually took a break from that idea after actually finding a well-paying software job that wasn’t horrible (on the bright side, my last project, though it failed utterly as a business, played a part in helping me get my current job).

Well, the lockdown happened, I got bored with all the extra time, and started on an open source project at least partially inspired by problems I’d faced at work over the last several years:

OpenDMP

It’s a platform meant to serve as a foundation for a (small) organization’s data management needs.

Screenshot!:

video_flow1273×952 57.2 KB

I’ve been trying to push the thought that this could grow into a business (i.e., open-core, services, etc.) to the back of my mind (to not get ahead of myself) until I can see if it catches on or not. It’s fairly early in development, needs more documentation, etc., but I’d appreciate any feedback and/or advice - esp. on the how to promote an open source project front

Thanks!

10 posts - 4 participants

Read full topic
item.source: My latest project - a data management tool

item.title: Website owners, I need your help testing my lighthouse audit tool!
item.dc:creator: DenisD
item.description:
Hi everyone!

I’m currently working on a tool runs automated website tests for SEO, Performance and other Lighthouse metrics: www.keeperapp.io

The main functionality is done, so now I’d like to gather as much websites as possible so every base is covered. I could add the generic cases like google.com or facebook.com but I need to be sure it works for every website out there! That’s where you come in. For the moment the tool is free to use, and as a thank you, beta testers will be able to keep their accounts (and its perks) for free after launch.

With this tool we aimed at making the lives easier of Digital Marketers and website owners. We wanted to make performance and metric testing as easy as possible while making sure all your data is completely in your hands. No installation needed, no service needs to be kept updated, any public-facing page can be tested (even that one competitor you need to keep an eye on).

Really looking forward to your feedback, any bugs can be reported using the red bug button in the lower right corner (after logging in) of your screen!

Cheers, Denis

1 post - 1 participant

Read full topic
item.source: Website owners, I need your help testing my lighthouse audit tool!

item.title: Working on a new app that injects a bunch of custom emoji into your Slack/Discord workspace. Would love your thoughts!
item.dc:creator: amongmany
item.description:
Hey there folks! Working on a new side project/toy for avid users of conversational workspaces like Slack and Discord. If you’re anything like me and the teams on which I participate, emojis are a huge element of our banter and conversations. We’re also fans of the custom emoji features, but finding the right emoji (especially for an in-the-moment reaction) is sometimes tough.

So we’re building an app that injects a boat load of custom emojis into these workspaces for you. We’re in the research phase at the moment and hoping to gather feedback and ideas from communities who use these apps often. Please check out the idea at moji.studio (yep, that’s the URL) and click the Sign Up button to answer a few quick questions (literally about 2 minutes).

1 post - 1 participant

Read full topic
item.source: Working on a new app that injects a bunch of custom emoji into your Slack/Discord workspace. Would love your thoughts!
